Issues.Title: Problems in is-loading
Issues.Body:
This is about a **bug** in a style of a button element.

### Description

The `.is-loading` class when used with `.button` is not displaying well in Safari on i(Pad)OS.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Get an i(Pas)OS device.
2. Open Safari.
3. Open an HTML page with Bulma CSS loaded plus this in the body:
```
<button class="button is-loading">Text</button>
```

### Expected behavior

<!-- What you expected to happen -->

Only the spinning ellipse should be visible in the button body.

<!-- What actually happened -->

The text was behind the spinning ellipse.

Issues.Title: Page rendering is broken by large <pre> element
Issues.Body:
This is bug or a feature request about Bulma (depending on your point of view I suppose.

### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** 0.9.2.
My **browser** is: Chrome 89
This is **not** a **Sass** issue
I *believe* this issue is **not a duplicate**.

### Description

A very long line in a `<pre>` elements, inside a column will force the column to be very wide (up to a certain size, then, even if the 
line continue to grow the column will not grow further)

### Steps to Reproduce

On a computer or a tablet, save the provided [minimal.txt](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/files/6444673/minimal.txt) file and rename it to `.html` (GitHub does not allow attaching html files directly it seems).

This document has 3 columns, with size 1/5th, 3/5th, 1/5th, and the center column contains some text and a `<pre>` element with very wide lines.

Open the document.

### Expected behavior

The main text in the center column should only take 3/5th of the width of the browser. The `<pre>` element should have a scroll-bar to be able to see the content that can’t fit in that width.

### Actual behavior

The "center" column extends with its content beyond the right of the viewport. There is no scrollbar so the right-side of the content cannot be seen (including an entire column at the right of the main one).

Here is a screenshot of the page as I see it:
![minimal](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3381888/117516338-24f7aa80-af99-11eb-961a-af187e6287fd.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Page rendering is broken by large <pre> element" (#3321)

Issues.Title: Card footer item button change
Issues.Body:
Add card-footer-item styles for button element
Change docs to use buttons over anchors
![Card Footer_before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/83301662/116315286-2937f280-a765-11eb-9c44-bcae1ce39f28.png)
![Card Footer_after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/83301662/116315291-2c32e300-a765-11eb-948a-65fa236f0492.png)

<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->
<!-- DO NOT REBUILD THE CSS OUTPUT IN YOUR PR -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is an **improvement**.
<!-- New feature? Update the CHANGELOG.md too, and eventually the Docs. -->
<!-- Improvement? Explain how and why. -->
<!-- Bugfix? Reference that issue as well. -->

The current `card-footer-item` implementation does not support buttons well and relies on anchor elements, which goes against A11y principles, as mentioned in [#953](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/pull/953).

I also changed the wording of the card-footer description in the docs.

### Proposed solution

<!-- Which specific problem does this PR solve and how?  -->
<!-- If it fixes a particular Issue, add "Fixes #ISSUE_NUMBER" in your title -->
Add styles to the `button.card-footer-item` selector to give them the look and feel of the existing `a.card-footer-item`.

### Tradeoffs

<!-- What are the drawbacks of this solution? Are there alternative ones? -->
<!-- Think of performance, build time, usability, complexity, coupling…) -->

The way I implemented may break one of the styleguide rules (Use only classes). I styled `button.card-footer-item` as opposed to `.button.card-footer-item` to allow for color modifiers to override the color I added to match the anchor tags. It's possible to make the improvement styling `.button.card-footer-item`, but color modifications (e.g. from `.is-primary`) won't be honored.

### Testing Done

I've only tested the docs and the behavior of `button.card-footer-item.is-primary` and `button.card-footer-item.is-ghost`. Considering the scope of the change and my limited understanding of the framework, I didn't know what else to test.

Issues.Title: custom shades are returning as a whole map and not working properly
Issues.Body:
Hi everyone
As there are certain prebuilt bulma shades given at utilities/derived-variables.sass

**Overview of the problem**
`$shades: mergeColorMaps(("black-bis": $black-bis, "black-ter": $black-ter, "grey-darker": $grey-darker, "grey-dark": $grey-dark, "grey": $grey, "grey-light": $grey-light, "grey-lighter": $grey-lighter, "white-ter": $white-ter, "white-bis": $white-bis), $custom-shades) !default`

there is scope to define custom shades same as custom-colors but it is returning a whole list due to automatically taking all four values (normal.dark,light,invert)

**Steps to Reproduce**
Define new variable named `$grey-custom` and `$custom-shades` and assign map value to that before importing bulma sass library.
```
$grey-custom: hsl(0, 0%, 25%) !default
$custom-shades: ("grey-custom": $grey-custom)
```

**Expected behavior**
class **has-background-grey-custom** should output only
`background-color: #404040 !important;`


**Actual behavior**
`background-color: #404040, #fff, whitesmoke, #878787 !important;`

Issues.Title: Add new Sass variable to customize .panel-block padding
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**.
This is a **feature** request.

### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**.
This is a **Sass** issue: I'm using version 1.32.8 of the dart sass npm package.
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**.

### Description

I would like to be able to customize `.panel-block` padding via a Sass variable. The current `panel.sass` source in version `0.9.2` of Bulma allows customization of `.panel-heading` padding via the `$panel-heading-padding` variable. It would be nice to have a similar variable for `.panel-block` elements.

```
// From panel.sass

.panel-heading
  background-color: $panel-heading-background-color
  border-radius: $panel-radius $panel-radius 0 0
  color: $panel-heading-color
  font-size: $panel-heading-size
  font-weight: $panel-heading-weight
  line-height: $panel-heading-line-height
  padding: $panel-heading-padding

...

.panel-block
  align-items: center
  color: $panel-block-color
  display: flex
  justify-content: flex-start
  padding: 0.5em 0.75em
  ...
```

### Steps to Reproduce
N/A

### Expected behavior
I would like to have a `$panel-block-padding` variable that is customizable via Sass.

### Actual behavior
The padding for `.panel-block` elements is hardcoded to `0.5em 0.75em`, and cannot be customized with a Sass variable.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add new Sass variable to customize .panel-block padding" (#3309)

Issues.Title: sticky hover on touch devices
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **Bulma**.

<!-- Is it about Bulma or about the Docs? -->
<!-- Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help? -->
<!-- If it's a bug, is it a browser bug? -->

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** 

I'm using Bulma **0.9.2** [x.x.x]
My **browser** is: any touch device
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**? yes, I checked
### Description

use `@media ( hover: hover )` instead of  `:hover` so the hover style wont stick around on touch devices

### Steps to Reproduce

get any class with hover effects let's say `.tabs` with the `<a>` inside 
get a touch device and touch the tab


### Expected behavior

for the hover style not to be applied to touch devices
OR
even better, for it to leave after finger is lifted but idk if that is possible

### Actual behavior

the hover style (the `color` and `border-bottom` in this case) will remain as described under `:hover` selector, until you touch somewhere else on the screen
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "sticky hover on touch devices" (#3308)

Issues.Title: Suggestion: Define a CSS variable for the current container width (screen width breakpoint)
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about Bulma.

<!-- Is it about Bulma or about the Docs? -->
<!-- Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help? -->
<!-- If it's a bug, is it a browser bug? -->

### Overview of the suggestion

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
<!-- This is about the Bulma **Docs** -->
I'm using Bulma **0.9.2**

### Description

May I suggest a new source code for the container.sass file:

```
@import "../utilities/mixins"

$container-offset: (2 * $gap) !default
$container-max-width: $fullhd !default

.container
  flex-grow: 1
  margin: 0 auto
  position: relative
  width: auto
  &.is-fluid
    max-width: none !important
    padding-left: $gap
    padding-right: $gap
    width: 100%
  +desktop
    max-width: $desktop - $container-offset
    --container-width: #{$desktop - $container-offset}
  +until-widescreen
    &.is-widescreen:not(.is-max-desktop)
      max-width: min($widescreen, $container-max-width) - $container-offset
      --container-width: #{min($widescreen, $container-max-width) - $container-offset}
  +until-fullhd
    &.is-fullhd:not(.is-max-desktop):not(.is-max-widescreen)
      max-width: min($fullhd, $container-max-width) - $container-offset
      --container-width: #{min($fullhd, $container-max-width) - $container-offset}
  +widescreen
    &:not(.is-max-desktop)
      max-width: min($widescreen, $container-max-width) - $container-offset
      --container-width: #{min($widescreen, $container-max-width) - $container-offset}
  +fullhd
    &:not(.is-max-desktop):not(.is-max-widescreen)
      max-width: min($fullhd, $container-max-width) - $container-offset
      --container-width: #{min($fullhd, $container-max-width) - $container-offset}
```

This will set the `--container-width` CSS variable which is very handy when you need to set the height of some things based on the width of the container, for example: `height: calc(100vh - var(--container-width, 100vw) / 3);`.

It will add just a few lines to the code, but will bring a lot of value to Bulma. I'm currently doing it manually in every build where I need it, but it would be nice to have it as a standard feature. Or name it `--containerWidth` if you prefer.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Suggestion: Define a CSS variable for the current container width (screen width breakpoint)" (#3303)
